intro: Alsine verna, commonly known as common alsike, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has small, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Alsine verna is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to temperate climates. It is sometimes cultivated as a forage crop for livestock due to its nutritional value.
